column4: 1. In your opinion, what is the primary reason companies pursue mergers or acquisitions?
column5: 2. How often do you think promised synergies are fully realized post-merger?
column6: 3. Which type of synergy is most overestimated during M&A announcements?
column7: 4.How many years post-merger do you believe are needed to fairly assess synergy realization?
column8: 5.  Which valuation method do you consider most prone to manipulation during M&A?
column9: 6.What, in your opinion, is the biggest risk to achieving post-merger synergies?
column10: 7.Do you think integration costs are usually underreported in investor presentations?
column11: 8.Have you come across a merger where reported EBITDA/synergies were clearly adjusted to look better than reality?
column12: 9.  How much faith do you place in “adjusted earnings” metrics shared after M&A deals?
column13: 10.  Do you believe non-controlling interest (minority interest) adjustments affect post-merger profitability perception?
column14: 11.  What percentage of M&A deals do you feel are overvalued at the time of acquisition?
column15: 12.  Have you ever seen an acquisition fail primarily due to valuation overreach?
column16: 13.  Which of the following metrics should be prioritized in post-merger performance analysis?
column17: 14.  Do you think that market sentiment often clouds the real success/failure of a merger in the short term?
column18: 15.  Which post-merger red flag is hardest to detect from financial statements?
column19: 16. Would a color-coded risk assessment model (RAG) be useful for identifying post-merger synergy shortfalls?
column20: 17.  Should investors have access to a standardized framework to track synergy performance post-M&A?
column21: 18.  What’s your view on using a 3-year performance window to assess actual synergy realization?
column22: 19.  Would you be interested in using a web-based dashboard that shows synergy realization with traffic-light indicators?
column23: 20. Lastly, do you feel that this research topic is practically useful for investors, analysts, and deal teams?
